intro: Saponaria nodiflora, commonly known as woolly betony, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and clusters of pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is known for its distinctive, soap-like scent when the leaves are crushed. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or dry habitats. Saponaria nodiflora is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
